name: Blood glucose testing strips not included in NHS England commissioning recommendations
title: Blood glucose testing strips not included in NHS England commissioning recommendations
description: Percentage of prescriptions for blood glucose testing strips (BGTS) not included in NHS England commissioning recommendations
numerator_short: BGTS prescriptions for strips not included in guidance
why_it_matters: In 2021-2022 there were approximately 470,000 people with diabetes receiving blood glucose strips, ketone strips, and lancets on prescription in England.  Consequently NHS England undertook a clincially-led assessment

of available products, reviewing both clinical and cost-effectiveness for patients and the NHS, and in April 2023 published <a href='https://www.england.nhs.uk/publication/commissioning-recommendations-blood-glucose-and-ketone-meters-testing-strips-and-lancets/'>
commissioning guidelines, recommending specific meters, test strips and lancets. This measure relates to the recommended blood glucose testing strips.
Please note: OpenPrescribing.net measures also have a consistent way of visualising measures, where 'lower is better', and therefore in this case we show the proportion of prescriptions for strips
which are NOT in the NHS commissioning recommendations.
